talks.title: An excursion in combinatorics on words
talks.author: Florin Manea
talks.desciption: In this talk, I will introduce several concepts from the area of combinatorics on words in a framework based on the notion of Word Equation. This perspective will allow us to travel from very basic problems in this area to some attractive open research problems. Along the way we will see interesting connections of combinatorics on words to mathematics and pure combinatorics, algebra, automata theory, computability, complexity theory, algorithms and data structures, and logic. But do not be afraid: we will also see some concrete applications of the ideas we present, useful in practice!

talks.title: New Results on Subsequence-Problems
talks.author: Stefan & Mia
talks.desciption: In this talk, we will present our group's recent results on string processing problems related to subsequences. A word u is a subsequence of another word w if u can be obtained from w by deleting some of w's letters. The first problem we tackle in this talk is the efficient testing of Simon's Congruence. Two words are k-Simon-congruent if they have exactly the same sets of subsequences of length at most k. The second problem is the Edit Distance of a word w to the set of words which have all possible strings of length k as subsequence. These are called k-subsequence universal words.

talks.title: Social Event
talks.author: Fachgruppe
talks.desciption: Diesen Slot füllst auch DU mit Inhalt: https://pad.gwdg.de/sit2020-socialize/

talks.title: Mit CSS Websiten schöner machen
talks.author: Ole Reglitzki
talks.desciption: The exercise is "choose some mediocre website and make it visually appealing". A short introduction will provide you with additional details. A basic understanding of CSS is recommended. You may work in small teams.

talks.title: eLegal - wer sind wir eigentlich ?
talks.author: Anton Wietzke
talks.desciption: Recht & Informatik passen nicht zusammen und die Digitalisierung wird Jura nicht bereichern? Wir denken schon! Das wollen wir bereits im Studium vermitteln und verändern. Dafür wollen wir die juristische Ausbildung praxisnah wie digital gestalten und eigene Lösungen für Kanzleien und Verwaltung entwerfen.

talks.title: Einstieg in Property based testing
talks.author: Lorenz Glißmann
talks.desciption: Tests schreiben ist nervig, anstrengend, kostet viel Zeit und - so fühlen sich viele - ist nichtmal besonders effektiv. Aber zum Glück gibt es Abhilfe: Tests generieren lassen! Property Based Testing ist eine Technik, die Elemente von Programmbeweisen mit den altbekannten beispielbasierten Unit-Tests kombiniert und viel Potential hat, Testing nicht angenehmer, sondern auch besser zu machen.

talks.title: Pfadabhängigkeit
talks.author: Astarix
talks.desciption: Warum sind Dinge wie sie sind? Wenn du mehr wissen willst, komm vorbei.

talks.title: Social Event
talks.author: Fachgruppe
talks.desciption: Diesen Slot füllst auch DU mit Inhalt: https://pad.gwdg.de/sit2020-socialize/

talks.title: Frontend Frameworks: Overview 2020
talks.author: Ole Reglitzki
talks.desciption: The frontend world is constantly changing. This talk provides an overview of the current (2020) web frameworks and their recent development, including vue, angular, react and svelte. Differences and issues of each are outlined to guide the choice for your next project or simply to learn in order to get an exciting job.

talks.title: Petasearch: Algorithm for fast, approximate comparison of huge protein sequence sets
talks.author: Jonas Hügel
talks.desciption: The Sequence Read Archive currently stores petabytes of DNA-sequences.  However, sequence similarity searching through this amount of sequences is not practical with current algorithms due to the large memory requirements for database index tables and insufficient speeds. Therefore, we developed the Petasearch algorithm.  We reduce the required memory through the usage of a diff-index structure. To maximize throughput of the prefilter, we exploit the caching and prefetch infrastructures of the CPU and the operating system, as well as the enormous read bandwidth of modern NVMe-SSDs to linearly process all indexed datasets.

talks.title: Architektur moderner Webanwendungen
talks.author: Dominik Seeger
talks.desciption: Jeder benutzt sie, alle lieben sie, aber kaum jemand macht sich Gedanken darüber, wie sie wirklich funktionieren: Webanwendungen haben in den letzten Jahren drastisch an Bedeutung gewonnen. Damit solche Anwendungen täglich mehrere Milliarden Anfragen bewältigen können, braucht es spezialisierte Hard- und Software. In diesem Talk findet ihr einen kleinen Überblick über die Technologie und Architektur hinter modernen Webanwendungen.
